messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: INCIDENT TRANSCRIPTION: ZZ-8970-OP DATE: 09/30/23  Arson at the Lakeside Public Library. At approximately 3:05 AM, Patrol Officer G. H. I. Black arrived at the scene following a distress call. Two other respondents: Public Relations Officer Ms. Lillian Stone and Librarian Mrs. Carla Winters. CRITICAL - HIGH IMPORTANCE CASE: FIRE DEPARTMENT & CRIME INVESTIGATION UNIT. MEDIA BRIEFING EXPECTED.  Sergeant J. K. L. Ford was first on call, working alongside Fire Marshall Steve. LOCATION: 99 Lakeside Avenue. By 3:30, the fire was under control, but significant damage was noted. Store owner Mr. Derek Johnson and local resident Miss Monica Rios reported seeing a shadowy figure near the library just before the fire started. Forensic Specialist Mark commenced evidence collection.  RELAY TO: CRIME INVESTIGATION UNIT 2 - SUMMARY [PRIORITY] Fire Marshall Steve, Sergeant Ford. OBSERVATIONS: Patrol Officer Black. DOCS RELEVANT: Rios, Monica 33 Harbor St, Lakeside, Georgia 445-778. 23456. LIBRARY FIRE 4:00 Arson Case.  Lt. M. N. O. P. White, overseeing the case, called in Detective Q. R. S. Gray and Detective T. U. V. Walker for an in-depth analysis. CCTV footage from a nearby cafe, analyzed by Crime Analyst Emily, showed a potential suspect fleeing the area.  DISPATCH TO: CRIME INVESTIGATION UNIT 2 - KEY OBSERVATIONS [NOTED] Forensic Specialist Mark, Detective Gray. LEAD INVESTIGATOR: Lt. White. COLLECTED EVIDENCE: (1) Charred Material (2) Gas Can (3) Anonymous Letter (4) Digital Footage (5) Broken Glass Fragments (6) Lighter LEAD COORDINATOR W. X. Y. Thompson C.I.U. 56.789 P90 5678 Stone, LILLIAN FILE: ORIGIN: CONTACT: 654-3210 RESPONDENT: G. Black ID: AB-1234- 567 ARSON TIME: 3:05 REPORT NUMBER 67890 - LOGGED James Smith DATE 10/01/23 SEND TO: CRIME INVESTIGATION UNIT.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Patrol Officer G. H. I. Black  
Officer Context: At approximately 3:05 AM, Patrol Officer G. H. I. Black arrived at the scene.  
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant J. K. L. Ford  
Officer Context: Sergeant J. K. L. Ford was first on call.  
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Fire Marshall Steve  
Officer Context: working alongside Fire Marshall Steve.  
Officer Role: Fire Marshall 

Officer Name: Forensic Specialist Mark  
Officer Context: Forensic Specialist Mark commenced evidence collection.  
Officer Role: Forensic Specialist 

Officer Name: Lt. M. N. O. P. White  
Officer Context: Lt. M. N. O. P. White, overseeing the case.  
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Detective Q. R. S. Gray  
Officer Context: Detective Q. R. S. Gray and Detective T. U. V. Walker for an in-depth analysis.  
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective T. U. V. Walker  
Officer Context: Detective Q. R. S. Gray and Detective T. U. V. Walker for an in-depth analysis.  
Officer Role: Detective
